title: add migration support
body:
## 1 Provider
The provider should first update to the latest Dubbo 3.0 version and change its RegistryConfig to 
```xml
 <dubbo:registry address="zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181?registry-type=service"/>
```
or 
```xml
 <dubbo:registry address="zookeeper://127.0.0.1:2181">
   <dubbo:parameter key="registry-type" value="service" />
</dubbo:registry>
```
Dubbo will register both `interface` and `application` address at the same time by default, this default behavior can be configured using: 
`dubbo.application.registry.publish-interface=true/false`

## 2 Consumer
The consumer is able to automatically migrate to `application` addresses without doing any changes, what you need to do is to update the Dubbo dependency to the latest 3.0 version. 

The behavior of the Consumer can be changed when it restarts, the behavior can even be changed on the fly. There is currently 3 migration status:
* INTERFACE_FIRST, this is the default status, this means the Consumer will use the previous `interface` addresses.
* APPLICATION_FIRST, check `application` addresses and `interface` addresses at the same time, switch to `application` when [the condition]() matches.
* FORCE_APPLICATION, force migrate to `application` addresses without any check.


The global default value is `INTERFACE_FIRST` and can be changed through item configured in Config Center:
`dubbo.application.service-discovery.migration=APPLICATION_FIRST`

If you want to switch between `interface` and `application` on the fly without having to restart the Consumer process, add the following config item in you Config Center:
KEY: the name of the Consumer
VALUE: 
```yaml
---
key: demo-consumer
step: APPLICATION_FIRST
...
```

### 2.1 Multiple Registries

title: fix #6379. Track the stacktrace of consumer-side while exceptoin happened in server-side.
body:
fix #6379. While exception happened in server-side, make stacktrace of consumer-side can be tracked.
(cherry picked from commit 70d3934bf1f91168b928c29025724d5519b5aa79)

## What is the purpose of the change

track the stacktrace of consumer-side by wrapping the server-side exception with a new RpcException.

## Brief changelog
wrap server-side's exception with RpcException.


## Verifying this change
throw an exception in server-side, throw or log the excetion in consumer-side, we can see where we invoke the remote method form the stack trace.

title: [Dubbo-6463] fix issue: start.sh can't work when dubbo.properties contain commented dubbo.protocol.port  property
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

fix issue #6463 : start.sh can't work when dubbo.properties contain commented dubbo.protocol.port  property

## Brief changelog

dubbo-container/dubbo-container-api/src/main/resources/META-INF/assembly/bin/start.sh

## Verifying this change

When configure the port of dubbo protocol in dubbo.properties file, start.sh will parse dubbo.properties using sed and get the dubbo protocol port number, then determine whether the application starts successfully by checking whether the port is opened.

But the mechanism of parsing dubbo protocol port isn't rigorous, when my dubbo.properties contains commented dubbo.protocol.port like this:

**#dubbo.protocol.port=20943
dubbo.protocol.port=20945**

start.sh will get wrong port number, and can't work normally.

title: fix issue: System property dubbo.service.delay is invalid
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Fixed issue #1728：System property dubbo.service.delay is invalid

## Brief changelog

ReferenceConfigBase.java
ServiceConfigBase.java

## Verifying this change

As described in issue #1728：we can't set dubbo.service.delay to dubbo through System Property，and System-Enviroment、Property-File mechanism also can't work. furthermore, other similar-style config(eg: dubbo.service.filter、dubbo.service.retries) are also invalid.

The troublemaker which caused this problem is:

**public String getPrefix() { return DUBBO + ".service." + interfaceName; }**

Due to these above codes，when getProperty through **CompositeConfiguration**, the packed key is （for examle）: **dubbo.service.org.yiocio.testService.org.yiocio.testService.delay**，this key's format is wrong according to dubbo's config strategy. In my view, dubbo's property-style config have a namespace concept: the first segment is **dubbo** at all times, the second segment is tag for config category（eg: application、registry、service），and the third segment is the id of config object with specific category，of course，the third segment is optional, the last segment is config key. So the override of getPrefix for ServiceConfigBase will break the namespace rule of dubbo config.

**ReferenceConfig's** situation is similar with **ServiceConfig**.

title: turn off reconnect for lazy in direct mode
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

For issue #6443 

## Brief changelog
即使是Lazy connect的模式，也不应该在请求的时候尝试建连，因为建连是有锁等待，会导致请求堆积。

lazy模式的第一个请求会主动建连，如果中间请求中断也要依靠ReconnectTimerTask恢复，请求不应该去尝试建连，所以默认关闭lazy的Reconnect，如果确实需要业务可以自己把开关再打开。

## Verifying this change

XXXXX

Follow this checklist to help us incorporate your contribution quickly and easily:

- [x] Make sure there is a [GITHUB_issue](https://github.com/apache/dubbo/issues) field for the change (usually before you start working on it). Trivial changes like typos do not require a GITHUB issue. Your pull request should address just this issue, without pulling in other changes - one PR resolves one issue.

title: [Dubbo-6463] fix issue: start.sh can't work when dubbo.properties contain commented dubbo.protocol.port
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

fix issue: start.sh can't work when dubbo.properties contain commented dubbo.protocol.port 

## Brief changelog

dubbo-container/dubbo-container-api/src/main/resources/META-INF/assembly/bin/start.sh

## Verifying this change

When configure the port of dubbo protocol in dubbo.properties file, start.sh will parse dubbo.properties using **sed** and get the dubbo protocol port number, then determine whether the application starts successfully by checking whether the port is opened.

But the mechanism of parsing dubbo protocol port isn't rigorous, when my **dubbo.properties** contains commented dubbo.protocol.port like this:

**#dubbo.protocol.port=20943
dubbo.protocol.port=20945**

start.sh will get wrong port number, and can't work normally.

title: [Dubbo-1728] Fix problem: System property dubbo.service.delay invalid
body:
## What is the purpose of the change

Fixed issue #1728：System property dubbo.service.delay invalid

## Brief changelog

ReferenceConfigBase.java
ServiceConfigBase.java

## Verifying this change

As described in issue #1728：we can't set dubbo.service.delay to dubbo through System Property，and System-Enviroment、Property-File mechanism also can't work. furthermore, other similar-style config(eg: dubbo.service.filter、dubbo.service.retries) are also invalid.

The troublemaker which caused this problem is:

**public String getPrefix() { return DUBBO + ".service." + interfaceName; }**

Due to these above codes，when getProperty through **CompositeConfiguration**, the packed key is （for examle）: **dubbo.service.org.yiocio.testService.org.yiocio.testService.delay**，this key's format is wrong according to dubbo's config strategy. In my view, dubbo's property-style config have a namespace concept: the first segment is **dubbo** at all times, the second segment is tag for config category（eg: application、registry、service），and the third segment is the **id** of config object with specific category，of course，the third segment is optional, the last segment is config key. So the override of getPrefix for ServiceConfigBase will break the namespace rule of dubbo config.

**ReferenceConfig's** situation is similar with **ServiceConfig**.

title: Fix export provider error, change to catch throwable, handle NoClassDefFoundError
body:
Fix export provider error, change to catch throwable, handle NoClassDefFoundError

## What is the purpose of the change
In org.apache.dubbo.metadata.store.InMemoryWritableMetadataService.publishServiceDefinition() and org.apache.dubbo.metadata.store.RemoteWritableMetadataService.publishProvider(), call the org.apache.dubbo.metadata.definition.ServiceDefinitionBuilder.build(java.lang.Class<?>) method, where NoClassDefFoundError may occur, So you need to catch the throwable in the outer layer, otherwise it will be difficult to find  the root cause of class loading failure

Please review this pull request, thank you
